Device Directory API

This API is initialized with ConnectionOptions.

To create an instance of this API in Node.js:

var MbedCloudSDK = require("mbed-cloud-sdk");

var devices = new MbedCloudSDK.DeviceDirectoryApi({
    apiKey: "<Mbed Cloud API Key>"
});

To create an instance of this API in the browser:

<script src="<mbed-cloud-sdk>/bundles/device-directory.min.js"></script>

<script>
    var devices = new MbedCloudSDK.DeviceDirectoryApi({
        apiKey: "<Mbed Cloud API Key>"
    });
</script>

Methods

addDevice

  • addDevice(device: AddDeviceObject): Promise<Device>

  • Add a device

    Example:

    devices.addDevice({
    certificateFingerprint: '07:7A:EB:67:37:42:4D:11:5C:3E:99:07:1E:EB:44:...',
    certificateIssuerId: '015c3c457b2002420a01041603c00000',
    name: 'newDeviceName'
})
.then(device => {
    // Utilize device here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • device: AddDeviceObject

      Device details

    Returns Promise<Device>

    Promise of device

  • addDevice(device: AddDeviceObject, callback: CallbackFn<Device>): void

  • Add a device

    Example:

    devices.addDevice({
    certificateFingerprint: '07:7A:EB:67:37:42:4D:11:5C:3E:99:07:1E:EB:44:...',
    certificateIssuerId: '015c3c457b2002420a01041603c00000',
    name: 'newDeviceName'
}, function(error, device) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize device here
});

    Parameters

    • device: AddDeviceObject

      Device details

    • callback: CallbackFn<Device>

      A function that is passed the arguments (error, device)

    Returns void

addQuery

  • addQuery(query: AddQueryObject): Promise<Query>

  • Add a query

    Example:

    devices.addQuery({
    name: 'TestFilter',
    description: 'Description here',
    filter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
})
.then(query => {
    // Utilize query here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • query: AddQueryObject

      The query

    Returns Promise<Query>

    Promise of query

listDeviceEvents

  • listDeviceEvents(options?: DeviceEventListOptions): Promise<ListResponse<DeviceEvent>>

  • List device events

    Example:

    devices.listDeviceEvents({
    limit: 50,
    filter: {
        deviceId: { $eq: "015c45eb321700000000000100100155" },
        eventDate: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2016"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
})
.then(deviceevents => {
    // Utilize deviceevents here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • Optional options: DeviceEventListOptions

      filter options

    Returns Promise<ListResponse<DeviceEvent>>

    Promise of listResponse

  • listDeviceEvents(options?: DeviceEventListOptions, callback?: CallbackFn<ListResponse<DeviceEvent>>): void

  • List device events

    Example:

    devices.listDeviceEvents({
    limit: 50,
    filter: {
        deviceId: { $eq: "015c45eb321700000000000100100155" },
        eventDate: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2016"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
}, function(error, deviceevents) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize deviceevents here
});

    Parameters

    • Optional options: DeviceEventListOptions

      filter options

    • Optional callback: CallbackFn<ListResponse<DeviceEvent>>

      A function that is passed the return arguments (error, listResponse)

    Returns void

listDevices

  • listDevices(options?: DeviceListOptions): Promise<ListResponse<Device>>

  • Gets a list of devices

    Example:

    devices.listDevices({
    filter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
})
.then(devices => {
    // Utilize devices here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • Optional options: DeviceListOptions

      list options

    Returns Promise<ListResponse<Device>>

    Promise of devices

  • listDevices(options?: DeviceListOptions, callback?: CallbackFn<ListResponse<Device>>): void

  • Gets a list of devices

    Example:

    devices.listDevices({
    filter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
}, function(error, devices) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize devices here
});

    Parameters

    • Optional options: DeviceListOptions

      list options

    • Optional callback: CallbackFn<ListResponse<Device>>

      A function that is passed the arguments (error, devices)

    Returns void

updateDevice

  • updateDevice(device: UpdateDeviceObject): Promise<Device>

  • Update a device

    Example:

    devices.updateDevice({
    id: '015c5ed320c0000000000001001000f0',
    name: 'Updated name',
    description: 'Updated description',
    customAttributes: {
        attr1: 'Use json structure',
        attr2: 'Can use 5 entries in the JSON struct'
    }
})
.then(device => {
    // Utilize device here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • device: UpdateDeviceObject

      Device details

    Returns Promise<Device>

    Promise of device

  • updateDevice(device: UpdateDeviceObject, callback: CallbackFn<Device>): void

  • Update a device

    Example:

    devices.updateDevice({
    id: '015c5ed320c0000000000001001000f0',
    name: 'Updated name',
    description: 'Updated description',
    customAttributes: {
        attr1: 'Use json structure',
        attr2: 'Can use 5 entries in the JSON struct'
    }
}, function(error, device) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize device here
});

    Parameters

    • device: UpdateDeviceObject

      Device details

    • callback: CallbackFn<Device>

      A function that is passed the arguments (error, device)

    Returns void

updateQuery

  • updateQuery(query: UpdateQueryObject): Promise<Query>

  • Update a query

    Example:

    devices.updateQuery({
    name: 'TestFilter',
    id: '015c45eb321700000000000100100155',
    filter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
})
.then(query => {
    // Utilize query here
})
.catch(error => {
    console.log(error);
});

    Parameters

    • query: UpdateQueryObject

      The query to update

    Returns Promise<Query>

    Promise of query

    devices.updateQuery({
    name: 'TestFilter',
    id: '015c45eb321700000000000100100155',
    filter: {
        state: { $eq: "bootstrapped" },
        createdAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") },
        updatedAt: { $gte: new Date("01-01-2014"), $lte: new Date("01-01-2018") }
    }
}, function(error, query) {
    if (error) throw error;
    // Utilize query here
